title: System Tray
description:
Phase 6: System tray icon for minimized operation.

Tasks:
- Setup tray icon using Tauri v2 TrayIconBuilder
- Menu: Offline (checked), Online, separator, Show Window, Quit
- Minimize to tray on window close (hide, don't quit)
- Double-click tray icon → show window
- Tray icon: grey=idle, colored=stealth active
- Quit properly shuts down proxy and restores config

Acceptance:
- Closing window minimizes to tray
- Tray icon shows current status
- Toggle stealth from tray menu
- Quit cleans up properly

title: Region Detection
description:
Phase 5: Auto-detect player region to connect to correct chat server.

Regions: BR→br1.chat.si.riotgames.com, NA→na2, EUW→euw1, etc.

Tasks:
- Primary: Parse Riot client config for chat server address
- Fallback: Parse RiotClientInstalls.json or settings.yaml
- Manual override: Region selector dropdown in frontend (only if auto fails)
- Store detected region in AppState

Acceptance:
- Region auto-detected on launch
- Proxy connects to correct regional chat server
- User can manually override

title: Error Handling & Polish
description:
Phase 7: Robustness and UX polish.

Tasks:
- Error handling: Riot not installed, port 5223 in use, TLS failure, config format changes
- Logging: tracing to app data dir, frontend log viewer, debug presence logging
- Auto-update: Check GitHub releases, non-intrusive notification
- Frontend: Connection animation, running game indicator, reconnect button, tooltips
- Crash cleanup: Panic hook restoring Riot config

Acceptance:
- No unhandled panics
- Logs on disk
- Actionable error messages
- Config restored even on crash

title: TLS Certificate Generation & Trust
description:
Phase 2: Generate self-signed CA at first launch, install in OS trust store.

Tasks:
- Generate root CA cert using rcgen on first launch, store in app data dir
- Load existing CA if already on disk instead of regenerating
- Use CA to sign server cert for 127.0.0.1 and localhost
- Install CA in OS trust store (macOS: security add-trusted-cert, Windows: certutil)
- Show dialog explaining admin access, only prompt once
- Create certs module in src-tauri/src/proxy/certs.rs

Acceptance:
- First launch generates CA + server cert in app data dir
- Second launch reuses existing CA
- CA is installed in system trust store
- TLS server with generated cert works without warnings

title: XMPP Proxy Core
description:
Phase 3: Bidirectional TLS proxy on localhost forwarding to real Riot chat server.

Tasks:
- Refactor xmpp_proxy.rs to use CA-signed certs from Phase 2
- Local TLS server on 127.0.0.1:5223
- Connect to real Riot chat server over TLS
- Bidirectional forwarding with tokio::io::split
- Implement stanza buffering (stanzas can split across TCP reads)
- Handle connection drops, multiple simultaneous connections
- Wire up presence filtering (client→server direction)
- mode_rx watch channel for real-time stealth toggle

Critical: Don't try to match <stream:stream> as a stanza. Only filter <presence>, <message>, <iq>.

Acceptance:
- Proxy accepts TLS on localhost:5223
- Data flows bidirectionally
- Presence stanzas modified when stealth is offline
- Non-presence stanzas pass through unmodified
- Split stanzas handled correctly (buffered until complete)

title: Riot Client Config Patching & Process Management
description:
Phase 4: Redirect Riot client chat connection to our proxy.

Tasks:
- Research Riot client config location/format (macOS + Windows)
- Implement Local Config HTTP Server (Option A, preferred):
  - HTTPS server on 127.0.0.1:5380
  - Proxy config requests, replace chat_host with 127.0.0.1
  - Launch Riot with --client-config-url flag
- Process management (riot/process.rs):
  - kill_riot_client(), launch_game(game), find_riot_client(), is_riot_running()
- Restore config on exit (Tauri on_window_event / RunEvent::ExitRequested)

Acceptance:
- Riot client connects to proxy instead of real chat server
- Real chat server address extracted from config
- Config restored on app exit
- Works on macOS and Windows
